We booked one of the 3 cabins on the property for my brother's wedding at Arching Oaks which was only 10 minutes away! It was perfect because the property is pet friendly, so we were able to bring our dog. There are a few friendly outdoor cats that followed us around.
We utilized the pool, hammocks and lounge chairs but they also have multiple grills and picnic tables available in the common area. It's such a peaceful property to beyond, and you will wake up to beautiful sunrises.
The cabins are set up right next to a hang gliding business so some days you may see them running, which is pretty cool.
Keep in mind (as the pictures show), you have to climb a ladder to access the top floor, which is where the bedroom is - so you must be willing and able to climb up and down.
We would love to come back again and highly recommend any individual or couple who is looking for a cute little quaint place to stay!

review_text: The stay was good. Very nice hosts who responded quickly and was very accommodating and helpful. Was a little disappointed in the parking set up. Towing a boat on a trailer with a big truck is not easy to pull in or back out of a one-car garage size driveway with an electric gate; but we managed; and the security of the gate was a nice thing. Not many amenities were there that would have been nice to have such as a baking dish/pan, foil (oven purposes), zip lock bags or Saran Wrap for covering food, more wash clothes, salt/pepper or any kind of condiments. The washer and dryer had two bottles of fabric softener but no laundry soap. I know it didn’t specifically say laundry soap was provided, but every Airbnb I’ve stayed at has had a washer/dryer and had laundry soap provided. Not a big deal though, luckily we had left a bottle in the truck from our last tournament a few weeks ago. Overall, it was a quiet place, nice and was clean. The house is actually attached to the hosts house; just a separate side and own entry; almost a duplex type feel to it, so didn’t feel very private. We were out fishing or there eating dinner and sleeping so that wasn’t a big deal. Even if we were there more, they didn’t bother us at all. Very nice hosts. Great response time and excellent with helping accommodate with the things that were not there. Thanks for the stay! It’s appreciated!

This is easily the BEST Airbnb I've stayed in, right from the private road you can already feel it’s coziness. It was absolutely AMAZING how clean the farmhouse was, from the moment you park out front everything just looks pristine.
The house itself is beautiful, the attention to detail really makes you wanna stay there forever, it’s so welcoming and home-like. It’s spacious, extremely clean, equipped with everything you’d need for your stay, they even have both Keurig and traditional coffee maker for you to choose from. The outside area is perfect for family time, it has a full kitchen outside which is perfect for cooking/barbecues, it has a huge table to fit a large family, plenty of lounging areas around with sofas, chairs and an egg swing.
The rooms are nice, the beds very comfortable, and the pillows were great! Every part of the home has a farmhouse feel, they owners truly have invested both time and money into their beautiful home.
There’s entertainment for everyone, from directv to board games. But please don’t stay inside the whole time because there’s so much to explore! They have chickens, and a rooster, who makes sure you get the full ranch experience by serenading you every morning! There are 2 different fire pit areas, and both of them are very fun for a fire night, the one in the back is larger and it was very cool to see such a big fire!
The neighbor ranches have farm animals, they’re precious and look very well taken care of. There is absolutely no bad smell, and all areas look super clean. The town is close by so if you need to make a Walmart run it’s not that far, but in my opinion it’s best to do the shopping beforehand so you can enjoy the tranquility of this ranch in peace, without having to step back out.
The owners left us a bottle of Prosecco, a box of truffle chocolates, and cookies! I mean Seriously? It was the sweetest Christmas gift and such a personal touch!!
I can’t thank them enough for allowing us to celebrate the holidays in their beautiful ranch, family memories were made that we’ll cherish forever. This is definitely a place I’d come back to every chance I get, I’m hooked for life!
Honestly, there are no negatives, even though the wifi didn’t work, we appreciated being able to disconnect and didn’t bother to have it fixed within our stay. You will not regret reserving this ranch!!

We expected this cabin to be cute and secluded from the photos and reviews - but I must say it passed all of our expectations! The cabin was perfect for two couples and our dog to unwind, relax, and enjoy the beautiful weather. With an adorable pool area and a few picnic tables - we managed to be outside most of the trip. The property itself is very secluded and makes it feel like a getaway even though we didn’t travel very far from the cities.
The cabins and sit right on the air gliding field so everyday you get to watch the plane take off and watch people air gliding - a very cool addition.
The only tips I will give is you may have to bring some charcoal for the grills, as well as some firewood if you want to use the bonfire area. Also we were lucky to have a breezy weekend and actually left the windows open a lot for fresh air, but the AC didn’t keep the place SUPER cool the first night. So we switched to open windows and lighter pjs.
Also if you need anything don’t be shy to reach out to James. He was very accommodating when we needed a few more pillows and blankets.
Overall we had a beautiful weekend, and our dog loved it too! Would definitely go back for a weekend getaway 🥰

This cabin is cute but smaller and more rustic than we anticipated. It is also not very private as there are the owners, hang gliders and other renters right nearby for most of the week. Please also understand that it is right on the florida ridge airsports park site and the cabin is right next to the office. So if you wish to hang glide (ages 12 and up) or sit and watch the hang gliders, you must book to be there between Friday, Saturday, Sunday and Monday.
The cabin is small and really better for sleeping than hanging out. The bed upstairs can only fit one and the couch bed two, but the pull out bed was uncomfortable and seemed on its last legs. There is a futon upstairs but it also shows great wear so bring any blankets, sheets, pillows and comfort items you might want. The upstairs bed was comfy though and we loved sleeping with the windows open.
Great open fields and sky and star gazing at night. Pool is not heated so it is too cold to swim in the winter months. We enjoyed the hammocks and the owner's pets, who are very friendly and well behaved (two dogs and a cat).
There is no stove so you will need to stove top cook, grill or microwave, or drive 20 to 30 min to nearest town if you want takeout.
Clewiston and La Belle are lovely quaint towns. In Clewiston we enjoyed getting our nails done at "The Nail Salon"--make an appointment and they are pricey but have great covid protocols. The Clewiston Goodwill is also excellent. We found some great stuff there.
Walking Lake Okeechobee was beautiful and just driving through the sugar was an experience.
You can tour the sugar factory but we didnt want to risk it during covid.
We are considering coming bsck to paddle fisheating creek and hang glide.
The owners are kind, friendly, and responsive.
A good choice if you don't mind rustic, other people, pets, and roughing it a little. Bring what you need since towns are 20 to 30 min away.

review_text: My family had a great time! We wanted a peaceful camping experience that we could include our dog. And our kids requested a pool. This was the perfect place, we could have all three (camping, dog, and pool)! My husband and I spent most of our days sitting outside, often on the hammock. There is a lot of space to walk around versus being tied to a little camp space and they give the option of a lot of places to sit back and relax, picnic tables, grills, and fire pits. It's pretty fun to sit outside at night and listen for the cows at the farm next door. Inside space had everything we needed to live for a few days and we brought a lot of our own food to make. We did get pizza from a place across the road and we went into town to get bbq at The Log Cabin. We also went into Clewiston to walk through Civic Park. We considered doing more activities but really just found ourselves enjoying our time there that we didn't feel the desire to get out much. Only issue is we tried to have a family movie night but the wifi connection to the tv wasn't great so the movie kept cutting out. Not really that big of a deal for us since our point of the trip was to unplug and get outside more. But if you need an internet connection it might be spotty. If you stay on a weekend you may get the pleasure of watching the hang gliding, we were able to watch a couple flights on the morning we left and I really could've watched that all day. The people who live onsite are also really friendly and there is currently a dog who likes to welcome guests. If we were not moving out of state in a couple months I'm sure we'd come back. Thank you for the experience!
